TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit EventHandlerList extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Provides a simple list of delegates. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class uses a linear search algorithm to find entries in the list of delegates. A linear search algorithm is inefficient when working with a large number of entries. Therefore, when you have a large list, finding entries is slow.
## Examples For an example of using an EventHandlerList, see [How to: Handle Multiple Events Using Event Properties](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddHandler (object key, Delegate value);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddHandler(object key, class System.Delegate value) cil managed

Docs.param: The object that owns the event.
The delegate to add to the list.
Docs.summary: Adds a delegate to the list.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddHandlers(class System.ComponentModel.EventHandlerList listToAddFrom) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds a list of delegates to the current list.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

remarks.format:
## Remarks Call Dispose when you are finished using the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventHandlerList>. The Dispose method leaves the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventHandlerList> in an unusable state. After calling Dispose, you must release all references to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventHandlerList> so the memory it was occupying can be reclaimed by garbage collection.
> [!NOTE] > Always call Dispose before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventHandlerList>. Otherwise, the resources the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventHandlerList> is using will not be freed until garbage collection calls the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventHandlerList> object's destructor.

MemberSignature.Value: public Delegate this[object key] { get; set; }

Docs.param: An object to find in the list.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets the delegate for the specified object.
Docs.value: The delegate for the specified key, or if a delegate does not exist.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the key is not found in the list and you provide a delegate to set the value of the key, then the key is added to the top of the list and assigned to the delegate as its value.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RemoveHandler (object key, Delegate value);

Docs.param: The object that owns the event.
The delegate to remove from the list.
Docs.summary: Removes a delegate from the list.
